medical_history.chief_complaint: A 14-year-old boy presented with gait difficulties and weakness in both feet.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms had insidiously started 10 years previously. Six weeks later, he presented with subacute respiratory distress, headache, nausea, vertigo, and fever, which resolved completely 6 hours after presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: X-linked dominant Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT1X) suspected based on clinical features and family history of foot deformities.
medical_history.family_history: Patientâ€™s mother had similar foot deformities from an early age; no other relatives had neurologic symptoms.
